alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:31PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Kit Carson County through 400 PM MDT... At 330 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles north of Bethune to near Stratton. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethune. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 413 and 431. Highway 385 between mile markers 197 and 206, and near mile marker 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
